Reason: The 'memtable_allocation_type' configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the memory allocation and management for memtables, which are critical for Cassandra's performance. Depending on the chosen allocation type, the system can experience notable performance variations in terms of memory usage and execution time. Therefore, any changes to this configuration can have a substantial impact on the system's overall performance.
